laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In January 2003, bromide levels drawn 6 days after his last exposure were 4.3 mg/dL in the serum

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased signal intensity on T2 and FLAIR sequences in the cerebellar dentate nuclei, periaqueductal region, dorsal midbrain and pons, and inferior olives symmetrically.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In June 2003, MRI showed normal brain findings, with resolution of previous signal abnormalities.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild slowing of motor conductions, reduced motor amplitudes and prolongation of late responses, with normal sensory potentials.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: In June 2003, nerve conduction studies were normal.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mildly impaired executive function as well as mild naming and attentional deficits.
